content.description: Triggering this process connects a cluster to the AMD Resource Manager. The subsequent steps will provide an installation script that must be run on the compute cluster, requiring kubectl access.
Install AMD Resource Manager Dispatcher on the compute cluster by copying and executing the following script.
content.note: Note that this script will only be displayed once with the connection secret!
content.confirmation: I have copied to execute the installation script on the target cluster.

content.description: After the script has been executed and the dispatcher has been successfully installed, the cluster will attempt to establish a connection with the AMD Resource Manager. You should see the cluster become active in the list of connected clusters. The process might take some time to complete.
content.instruction: If you face any errors during the installation process, please refer to

notifications.failure: Failed to request to connect a new cluster. Please try again later.

baseUrl.label: Base URL for the cluster.
baseUrl.placeholder: Provide base URL for the cluster
baseUrl.emptyError: Base URL must not be empty

error.invalid: Base URL must be a valid URL (must start with http:// or https://)

confirmation.title: Confirm Deletion
confirmation.description: Are you sure you want to delete this cluster? This action is irreversible.

notification.error: Failed to delete cluster. Please try again.

confirmation.title: Confirm Cancellation
confirmation.description: Are you sure you want to cancel this cluster connection request?

notification.error: Failed to cancel cluster request. Please try again.

nodes.title: Available nodes
nodes.tooltip: Total number of nodes available in the cluster. AMD Resource Manager routinely pulls node information from the cluster including resources and health.

projects.title: Assigned projects
projects.tooltip: Projects assigned to the cluster resources. Projects can be assigned guaranteed resources on cluster, or can assiged no resources and run on best-effort basis.

gpus.title: Allocated GPUs
gpus.tooltip: Total number of GPUs allocated to quotas in the cluster. Users belonging to projects with GPU quotas are guaranteed allocated GPU resources for their workloads.

workloads.title: Running workloads
workloads.tooltip: Total number of active workloads running on the cluster. Workloads submitted via AMD Resource Manager optimally scheduled, and tracked and monitored for resource usage and health.

clusters.title: Clusters
clusters.tooltip: Clusters for your organization that have been connected to AMD Resource Manager. Connecting clusters allows you to manage resources, quotas, and workloads on them.

nodes.title: Available nodes
nodes.tooltip: Total number of nodes available across all clusters. AMD Resource Manager routinely pulls node information from clusters including resources and health.

gpus.title: Allocated GPUs
gpus.tooltip: Total number of GPUs allocated to quotas, across all clusters. Users belonging to projects with GPU quotas are guaranteed allocated GPU resources for their workloads, in the corresponding clusters.

workloads.title: Running workloads
workloads.tooltip: Total number of active workloads across all clusters. Workloads submitted via AMD Resource Manager optimally scheduled, and tracked and monitored for resource usage and health.
